text: Abel Joseph Rodriguez Jr. (January 16, 1922 – July 17, 2010) was an American professional basketball player. He played for the Oshkosh All-Stars in the National Basketball League for eight games during the 1947–48 season and averaged 1.1 points per game. He later coached high school basketball. He had a dog named Peach and two sons named Gabe and Frank Rodriguez they both played college basketball for 2 years. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:2010 deaths Category:American men's basketball players Category:Basketball players from California Category:Guards (basketball) Category:Hartnell Panthers men's basketball players Category:Oshkosh All-Stars players Category:Professional Basketball League of America players Category:Sportspeople from San Jose, California
title: Abel Rodrigues
